metadata.title: USN-5342-2 -- Python vulnerabilities
metadata.description: USN-5342-1 fixed several vulnerabilities in Python. This update provides the corresponding update for Ubuntu 14.04 ESM, Ubuntu 20.04 ESM and Ubuntu 22.04 ESM.  Original advisory details:   It was discovered that Python incorrectly handled certain FTP requests.  An attacker could possibly use this issue to expose sensitive information.  (CVE-2021-4189)   It was discovered that Python incorrectly handled certain inputs.  An attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code.  (CVE-2022-0391)  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-5342-2` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.18-13ubuntu1.1+esm2 libpython2.7 - 2.7.18-13ubuntu1.1+esm2 python2.7 - 2.7.18-13ubuntu1.1+esm2 idle-python2.7 - 2.7.18-13ubuntu1.1+esm2 libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.18-13ubuntu1.1+esm2 libpython2.7-dev - 2.7.18-13ubuntu1.1+esm2 python2.7-minimal - 2.7.18-13ubuntu1.1+esm2 python2.7-doc - 2.7.18-13ubuntu1.1+esm2 python2.7-dev - 2.7.18-13ubuntu1.1+esm2 python2.7-examples - 2.7.18-13ubuntu1.1+esm2 libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.18-13ubuntu1.1+esm2 Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
